personas.name: Pekka (The Rural Traditionalist)
personas.social_media_usage: Suomi24 and car forums; consumes tabloid car news.
personas.role: Defender of internal combustion engine (ICE) reliability; voice of rural skepticism.
personas.behaviors: He maintains a **2004 Toyota Camry** with DIY additions and wooden bead seat covers, believing it is superior to new, unreliable German cars [1-3]. He avoids EVs in winter, fearing they will fail at **-30°C** and leave him stranded in a 'savimaja' (hovel) [1, 4, 5].
personas.goals: To keep his current car running 'until the grave' and avoid government 'traps' like **electricity transfer fees** or higher taxes on the poor [1, 6, 7]. He wants a vehicle that can refuel in 2 minutes for a 1000km range [1, 8].
personas.motivations: Practicality and survival; he views the EV subsidy as a wealth transfer from the poor to the rich who have 'extra money' for 50,000€ 'battery toys' [1, 2, 9].
personas.other_information: He practices **'munkkielämä' (monk life)** to survive on roughly 500€/month and considers car taxes a punishment for being poor [10-12].

personas.name: Elena (The High-Income Urbanite)
personas.social_media_usage: Heavy usage of Autostadium and LinkedIn; shares travel and luxury acquisitions.
personas.behaviors: She changes cars every 2–3 years, favoring **Teslas or premium German brands** with cognac-colored leather interiors [13-16]. She mocks 'fossil' drivers and enjoys high performance, such as 0–100 kph in **3.4 seconds** [17-20].
personas.goals: To maintain a 'green' corporate image and utilize EVs to lower the **taxable benefit (verotusarvo)** of her company car [21-24]. She wants to see ICE vehicles 'killed by taxation' to clear the way for electrification [21, 25].
personas.motivations: Status and technological dominance; she views the subsidy as a rightful return on her high taxes [21, 26, 27].
personas.other_information: She owns a house valued at **460,000€** with dedicated home charging, making the transition to electric seamless for her lifestyle [28-30].

personas.name: Jorgos (The Working Immigrant)
personas.social_media_usage: Facebook groups like 'Sähköautot.nyt' and Uber app user.
personas.role: Pragmatic commuter and potential sähkötaksi driver.
personas.behaviors: He drives long distances for work in 'matu-lähiö' (immigrant suburbs) and is interested in EVs purely for low running costs, though he finds itselataava (non-plug-in) hybrids to be a 'bensa-kusetus' (gas scam) [31-34].
personas.goals: To reduce his daily 70km commute cost to **'2 euros per 100km'** [31, 35-37]. He hopes for a used EV market where a Nissan Leaf might cost only **5,000€** [38-40].
personas.motivations: Financial efficiency; he is motivated by the potential **1,000€ per month savings** possible by switching from diesel to electricity for professional driving [22, 41, 42].
personas.other_information: He faces the **'latausmahdottomuus' (charging impossibility)** in his taloyhtiö (housing company) where 2-hour heating poles are the only power source [32, 43, 44].

personas.name: Sini (The Gen Z Activist)
personas.social_media_usage: TikTok and Instagram; follow environmental activists like Greta Thunberg.
personas.behaviors: They advocate for dumping all 'polttikset' (ICE vehicles) and believe **Greta Thunberg** leads with military-like precision [45, 46]. They use public transit but see EVs as a necessary evil to replace 'nokiapinat' (soot monkeys/diesel drivers) [25, 47].
personas.goals: To make Finland **hiilineutraali (carbon neutral)** by 2035 and see the state provide EVs for free to the poor [7, 45, 47, 48]. They want subsidies to apply to micro-mobility like e-bikes [47, 49].
personas.motivations: Environmental ethics; they believe humans will be destroyed if consumption is not drastically reduced [50-53].
personas.other_information: Practices extreme 'munkkielämä' (monk life) and believes that the only way to save the planet is to stop 'turhaturismi' (unnecessary tourism) [10, 11, 46, 54].

personas.name: Marjatta (The Rural Entrepreneur)
personas.behaviors: She drives a **heavy 4x4 diesel** to pull trailers for her business and worries about property values dropping without charging infrastructure [55-57]. She checks real-world user data on range and winter performance before trusting 'green' hype [58, 59].
personas.goals: Wants a car with a **300km range** that costs under 30,000€ and includes a **trailer hitch** for her work [55, 60-62]. She seeks a predictable total cost of ownership (TCO) [58, 63].
personas.motivations: She refuses to pay a 60,000€ premium for a 'patteripetteri' (battery toy) and fears government 'traps' where EVs are cheap now but will be taxed per kilometer later [4, 43, 64, 65].
personas.other_information: She is the 'tavis' (average person) who believes sähköautovastustus (EV resistance) stems from a **lack of information** and realistic infrastructure [66-68].
